did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle:
Goathland, North Yorkshire, sword dance photograph collection,
ca. 1912-1950
.
did.physdesc: 7 photographic prints : black and white; 6 1/2 x 4 1/2 in.

corpname.part: Archive of Folk Culture, American Folklife Center, Library of Congress

did.abstract: A collection of black-and-white photographic prints, circa 1912 to 1950 of the Plough Stots Long Sword team from Goathland, North Yorkshire, England, in candid shots, formal poses, and in dance performance. Includes images of long swords, costumes, musical instruments, and the characters of Bessy (or Betty), Poss (Toss Pot) and Old Man. The identity of the photographer is unknown.

controlaccess.head: Selected Search Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the LC Catalog. They are grouped by name of person or organization, by subject or location, and by occupation and listed alphabetically.

title.part: Former title: Morris dance photograph collection

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized by format into the following series: Series 1: Photographs.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: The photographs were given to Wendy Grossman by Gordon Norman of Beverley, England.

userestrict.head: Copyright Status
userestrict.p: Duplication of the photographs may be governed by copyright and other restrictions.

accessrestrict.head: Access and Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. To request materials, please contact the Folklife Reading Room at http://hdl.loc.gov/loc.afc/folklife.contact

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Goathland, North Yorkshire, Sword Dance Photograph Collection (AFC 1983/007) Archive of Folk Culture, American Folklife Center, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: In 1922, the Goathland Plough Stots were revived from local memory by Frank W. Dowson, who is identified in notes (as "Dawson") on the reverse of some of these photographs. The Goathland Plough Stots is one of Yorkshire's traditional long sword dance teams of 6 to 8 dancers, who perform a dance that ends with swords in the formation of a "lock", which in this case resembles a Star of David. The teams traditionally dance in January on Plough Monday, the Monday following the feast of Epiphany, and at other times during the year.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: A collection of photographs of the Plough Stots Long Sword team from Goathland, North Yorkshire, England in candid shots, formal poses, and in dance performance. Includes images of long swords, costume, and musical instruments.

Includes seven 6 1/2" x 4 1/2" black and white photographs of the Plough Stots Long Sword team from Goathland, North Yorkshire, England. Descriptive notes were transcribed from the reverse of the photographs.
Sword dance performance. "The side in the 30s or 40s. More poss. after Second World War. Goatland [sic] (Plough Stots). Note Dawson far left."

did.unittitle: "Bessie" and "Old Man" posing next to crowd

scopecontent.p: "Bessie" and "Old Man" posing next to crowd. "About 1930. Goatland (Plough Stots) Long Sword (North Yorks.). Bessy (Betty) and Old Man. Poss (Toss Pot)."

Posed shot of group (approximately 20 people)."Frank Dawson who collected and reformed the side after the First World War. First on left. Goatland (Plough Stots). Long Sword North Yorks. At a time when the play was done. Play lost in a fire."

did.unittitle: Group walking up a path towards camera (approximately 16 people)

scopecontent.p: Group walking up a path towards camera (approximately 16 people). "Goatland (Plough Stots) North Yorkshire. About 1950 going into Brekmole [or Brekhole]. Walking tour."

did.unittitle: Posed shot of group in front of building (approximately 9 people)

scopecontent.p: Posed shot of group in front of building (approximately 9 people). "About 1945-6. North Yorks. Goatland (Plough Stots)."

did.unittitle: Posed shot of group in front of building (approximately 16 people)

scopecontent.p: Posed shot of group in front of building (approximately 16 people). "Goatland Long Sword (Plough Stots). Pre First World War. Approx. 1912."
